intro: Myriocarpa obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is known for its milky sap, which is typical of the Apocynaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Myriocarpa obovata plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
